newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA'S OPPOSITION CHIEF SAYS CABINET INEPT.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA'S OPPOSITION CHIEF SAYS CABINET INEPT.

text.p: Bulgaria's anti-communist opposition leader on Wednesday accused the socialist government of incompetence and neglect in its efforts to tackle the country's acute economic crisis.

"Prime Minister Zhan Videnov tries to hide Bulgaria's troubles like the grain crisis and to solve them without even admitting that they exist," said Ivan Kostov of the Union of Democratic Forces (UDF) in an address on state radio.
He said the government was responding to events with stopgap measures and had failed to hammer out a coherent strategy to overcome Bulgaria's economic difficulties.

Kostov, a former finance minister, identified Bulgaria's grain shortage, growing school truancy and illiteracy among young people and the plight of the elderly as areas of particular concern. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 4145
